body.p:
Washington cit
March 19th 1862
My Dear Sir

There is confined in the penitentiary James John who is imprisoned for killing -- Wm Guill in Boon Co He was sentenced to imprisonment for five years -- I have been informed that the court -- all the jury have petitond for his release -- I understand that he commited the act when he was very drunk -- that he is at best a very silly man -- Mr. Perry McNeely of Boone County was the constable that arrested him & he informe me that Sebree was drunk when he committed the offence -- I know McNeely and reson him a reliable gentleman -- He will call your attention to the case -- from all I I think this man ought to be pardoned And respectfully call your attention to its and Join & Join its Petition, in a recommendation for his pardon

Hon B. Magoffin
Gov of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Sebrees case

Hon B. Magoffin
(Gov. of Ky)
Frankfort
Kentucky
